title.narrative: Preservation of the Ancient Rock Art of Nigeria in Jigawa and Cross River States

description.narrative: The cave paintings of Birnin Kudu in Jigawa are thousands of years old, and the carved Ikom monoliths in Cross River display unique combinations of motifs such as facial features and tribal markings. This project, which endeavors to strengthen Nigeria's network of rock art conservation specialists across regions, directly supports the Embassy's efforts to promote political unity, economic development, and social inclusion.

title.narrative: Documentation of the Traditional Knowledge of the Ifa in Nigeria

description.narrative: The chants of babalawos, or elderly priests, of the Ifa are reflections of Yoruba history, language, and beliefs. title.narrative: Preservation and Protection of Ethnographic Objects in the National Museum of Unity in Enugu

description.narrative: To support the preservation and protection of regional ethnographic and ancient objects of the Igbo people and others in the National Museum of Unity in Enugu. The museums collection of pottery, tools, masks, musical instruments, and costumes are highly susceptible to deterioration from exposure to rodents, insects, heat, and humidity. This project involves the design and installation of secure display cases with appropriate lighting and temperature controls.

title.narrative: Protect, Shelter and Heal: Victim-Centered Technical Assistance for Sub-Saharan African Governments and Civil Society

description.narrative: Using Bujumbura, Burundi and Abuja, Nigeria as regional hubs, Heartland Alliance International (HAI) will develop a T&TA module for victim identification and referral services. Based on the module, HAI will deliver up to 24 months of assistance to beneficiary governments in sub-Saharan Africa selected in consultation with the TIP Office. The overall objective of the project is to expand victims access to quality and comprehensive services, including through the creation and/or strengthening of a comprehensive victim referral mechanism and the provision of shelter and related services. The intervention in each beneficiary country will be tailored to meet the needs of that target country and the profile of the victim population.
